basics.name: Julian Brown
basics.label: Software Engineer
basics.summary: Highly motivated software engineer with experience writing high performance software in Go, Java, and C++. Also experienced in building fast, responsive, and accessible websites using core web technologies. A self-starter and passionate about devops, developer productivity, high performance software and distributed systems.

work.summary: Infrastructure SME/Lead for the Consulting Team (100+ team members)
highlights: Reduced our Fortune 500 clients cost-per-click ad spend by 70% by building fast, responsive and accessible static landing pages using ES6 Javascript, Sass, Webpack, and Soy (Closure) templates (e.g cafe.haagen-dazs.es.yext-cdn.com).
Decreased CI/CD build times by 80% for the Consulting Engineering monorepo by migrating our build system from Make to Bazel.
Improved developer productivity by designing and implementing a CI tool to automatically build and serve pull requests to Consulting Pages sites using Go, Docker, Nginx, and Jenkins.

Prevented incidents and reduced resolution times by designing and implementing a monitoring/alerting system for services and products offered by the Consulting organization using Go, Prometheus, and Alertmanager.
Enabled teammates by writing codelabs, hosting brown bags and keeping documentation up to date.

Reduced total development time of Spacecraft Flight Software for other teams by writing and maintaining file transfer, file manager and file system libraries and their associated unit and integration tests in C
Decreased Cygnus Spacecraft testing and development lead time by modeling numerous embedded components in C++ for SITL and HITL simulations.

work.summary: Study of perturbations generated by stratified incompressible thermo-hydrodynamics (PI. Dr. Paterson)
highlights: Supported PhD candidates by creating and running CFD simulations of perturbations generated by thermo-hydrodynamic disturbances using OpenFOAM and Python
Constructed 3D images of flow from 2D images using python and ParaVIEW.
Greatly reduced preliminary rocket motor design lead time by developing a GUI rocket motor sizing application (RocketSolver) in C# to be used by other members of the team.

work.summary: Modeling of a Hall Effect thruster using C++ (FA. Dr. Srinivasan)
highlights: Produced real time visual simulations charged particles within a Hall Effect thruster using C++ and OpenGL.
